channel.title: integral on the breadblog
channel.description: Recent content in integral on the breadblog

item.title: perfect pain integral with an open crumb
item.description: The holy grail of a whole grain hearth bread with an open crumb…can be achieved—even as a fleeting anomaly wholly dependent on the seasonal qualities of the grain used. — Chad Robertson, Tartine Bread The bread below is the “holy grail”. It was delicious, so I hope it’s not too fleeting. The crust is not very crunchy (compared to pain complet with at least 25% white flour) but the intense caramel wheat flavor makes up for it.
